metadata.title: CVE-2022-36402 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability was found in vmwgfx driver indrivers/gpu/vmxgfx/vmxgfx_execbuf.c in GPU component of Linux kernel withdevice file '/dev/dri/renderD128 (or Dxxx)'. This flaw allows a localattacker with a user account on the system to gain privilege, causing adenial of service(DoS).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36402` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic-64k - 5.15.0-91.101
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1048-kvm - 5.15.0-1048.53
No subscription required
